thread.title: UCLA great Meyers succumbs to cancer
thread.title_full: UCLA great Meyers succumbs to cancer

title: UCLA great Meyers succumbs to cancer
text:
UCLA great Meyers succumbs to cancer Helped Bruins to 1975 championship By The Sports Xchange Jason Antony/SXC TEMECULA, Calif. - 
Dave Meyers, who helped lead UCLA to the 1975 NCAA basketball championship in coach John Wooden's final season, died Friday at 62 after a battle with cancer. Related Content 
Meyers, who was drafted by the Los Angeles Lakers and also played for the Milwaukee Bucks in the NBA, died at his home in Temecula, according to UCLA. 
Meyers is survived by his wife, Linda, daughter Crystal and son Sean. Distributed by LAKANA and The Sports Xchange. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
